meanings.definition: To freeze or chill in advance.
meanings.sent1: She always prefreezes the fruits before making smoothies.
meanings.sent2: It is a good idea to prefreezes the cookie dough for easier baking later.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally prefreezes the lettuce, turning it into a crunchy salad popsicle.
meanings.sent4: His fear prefreezes him in place, unable to move or speak.
meanings.sent5: The icy wind prefreezes everything in its path, creating a winter wonderland.

meanings.definition: The act of freezing or chilling in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prefreezes of the meat helped save time during dinner preparation.
meanings.sent2: She always makes prefreezes of her favorite soups for quick meals.
meanings.sent3: The prefreezes of the drinks were a hit at the party, keeping them cold for hours.
meanings.sent4: The prefreezes of the lake made it a perfect spot for ice skating.
meanings.sent5: The prefreezes of the ice cream kept it fresh and ready to serve at any time.
